body: I can confirm it happens in Gnome Terminal running Bash.

Unfortunately #1688 didn't completely solve the issue, as it still allows the alternate screen to be opened, which causes what _appears_ to be a screen reset (but is actually just the alternate buffer being super-imposed) regardless of `clearScreen` config.

To properly address this, you'd need to configure the alternate screen [here](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/blob/d94db0f2ee23cc4a036c645b517b9dcb94659eb6/bin/src/run/watch.ts#L33), perhaps by adding a boolean parameter `clearScreen` and modifying [screen.reset](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/blob/d94db0f2ee23cc4a036c645b517b9dcb94659eb6/bin/src/run/alternateScreen.ts#L32) to omit the special characters appropriately. The problem is, right now, the config isn't evaluated until after `start()` is called, which is wayyyyy after the `alternateScreen()` factory has been initialized (and `screen.open()` has been called).

I think it's safe to require restarting the whole watcher process if you change those options in a config file that you'd normally expect to hot-reload. It's maddening otherwise, since several TTY-related options have already been essentially hard-coded during the initialization of the watcher parent process.

https://github.com/evocateur/rollup/commit/d74e4492fd5c39f94d8ef6819c074b634508d130 avoids clearing the screen when `{ watch: { clearScreen: false } }` is passed from a `rollup.config.js` in _any_ provided config block.

Curious if any progress has been made on this. Would be great to not have the screen clear each time rollup does its thing...

Thanks in advance for the effort. Much appreciated!
No yet I am afraid. PR welcome :)

Thanks @lukastaegert. Appreciate the quick reply. :)

I can only offer a "would if I could" on the PR. This is a bit out of my comfort zone.
